subject: Economics
title: Reciprocity Bias: The Free Sample Trap
description: A short lesson to help you apply Reciprocity Bias: The Free Sample Trap.

hook.text: A waiter gives you a free mint and tips increase 3%. Two mints? 14%. A personalized mint? 23%.

buildup.text: Reciprocity is deeply hardwired: when someone gives us something, we feel compelled to give something back.

discovery.text: Costco's free samples generate $5.8 billion in additional sales yearly.

twist.text: The Hare Krishna movement funded itself by giving flowers at airports.

climax.text: Reciprocity isn't generosity â€” it's a transaction our brains process automatically.

punchline.text: Nothing is more expensive than something that's free.

quiz.question: Why do free samples dramatically increase sales?
options: People discover new products they like
Reciprocity bias creates a subconscious obligation to buy after receiving something free
